Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Tim N
Reviews.Content: Excellent location (close to Leidse Plein and Vondelpark), excellent service, great rooms with very good beds, couldn't ask for more!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Kristoffer1982
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel located centrally in Amsterdam. Great bathroom with tub, great beds and not noisy at all. Their all inclusive services is a very good idea.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: brh17
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights, and was very happy with our choice. Good value for money. Why spend hundreds of pounds on a posh hotel, when you are out exploring most of the time. Nice, friendly staff, good location, near to centre and museums, and very comfortable beds! Could not fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Good for one or two nights, nothing more.”
Reviews.Author: pposte
Reviews.Content: The Roemer is tucked back from the street near central Amsterdam. Easy to walk to major sites like the Van Gogh Museum and other major museums. Good restaurants nearby. The hotel staff are very friendly. The mini bar is complimentary as are a very wide variety of drinks down in the lobby that are out for the guests throughout the day. Lobby is quite small, but does the job. Keep in mind this is a "boutique" hotel. Rooms are quite small with very little closet space. Again, come here for a night or two. Jacuzzi tub in the bathroom is a very nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for an Amsterdam weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: EmsterJ
Reviews.Content: This hotel was exactly what we were looking for - great location, nice rooms and friendly service. Breakfast and drinks are included in the room rate. Great value for money. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location just near the Vondelpark”
Reviews.Author: Peter R
Reviews.Content: This is a small elegant hotel with a great location, just near the Vondelpark. It is so comfortable to be at only 10 minute walk from the busiest area of the city but having near a beautiful park where you can just go and relax. The room which they gave us was large and comfortable and we didn't expect to have a Nespresso coffee machine. The bathroom is spacious and the double shower was really very comfortable. Suggested to people who love small hotels in city center but not too close to the busiest part of it.

Reviews.Title: “Too many little details add up”
Reviews.Author: StanleyAggeridge
Reviews.Content: This is, at first glance, an excellent hotel. Expensive, very "boutique" very design-conscious. However, if you're going for the exclusive end of the market, the devil is in the detail. The location is superb. Very quiet, minutes from Vondelpark with the Vertigo cafe (the film museum is moving). Minutes from Leidseplein with trams to all parts. Close to the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh museum too. There are several REALLY good restaurants nearby, and a host of great walks (one reviewer mentioned this being out of the way; it took me twenty minutes to walk to Centraal - so it's not that bad!) We didn't include breakfast (we went to Pancake Corner one day, and Vertigo another), as at 19 Euros, it seemed a little steep. The staff were very welcoming and helpful. Our first room was tiny. Laughably so. It was [literally] impossible to walk other than sideways from the TV onwards. The TV itself was against a side wall, and had top be manoeuvred out to be watched, then getting it back in to avoid limbo-dancing past it required a degree in mechanical engineering. There was no welcome manual in the room, so the Nespresso machine was a mystery to me. There was only one remote, but two TVs. The bathroom mirror was badly cracked, and the crack had collected a fair bit of dirt, so it had been that way for some time. There was also mould between some shower tiles. We went for a walk just after 0900, and returned at 1530, to find the room had not yet been made up. Conversely, a good read of any establishment is how they handle complaints; we made the cracked mirror and mould issues known to the staff, and were whisked off to another, larger room with profuse apologies, and a lovely bottle of wine and some canapes. This room had all the remotes! And a welcome manual. Multiple TVs are a nice idea, but if you ARE going to put them in the room (and personally I have no need for them) - make it elegant, both in appearance and in use. All three TVs had different channel set-ups, so if you were watching something fascinating that you wanted to continue in the shower (?) - finding it was an exercise in frustration, as the channel numbers were not the same. Appearance: the idea of hidden DVD players is very nice, but a hotel of this style shouldn't have spaghetti nests of cable hanging below TVs on the wall. Another small point (I did say these were small issues) is that there was a separate alcove at the far end of the room, which was a lovely idea; perhaps your partner wants to snooze, and you fancy reading a book? Unfortunately there is no separate lighting for these areas, so your partner can damn well try to sleep with the lights on! It's a double room, but there is only one miniature shower gel and one shampoo bottle in the toilet. A small point, but it makes a difference. A big problem is the noise: I know I said it's a quiet area (and it is), but the three big rooms on the ground floor are right next to the kitchen, which starts clattering a LOT around 0700. Then you have early-rising guests shouting conversations to the staff, from the dining room to the reception desk. Good - Great staff. A nice "living room" feel to the lounge area. A laptop for Internet access. On that note - I'm not overly keen on hotels charging for Wifi. We know how much it costs, and it's not a killer for a hotel, but it makes a huge difference to the stay if you need access. Paying daily or hourly rates seems cheap and tacky. Very comfy beds - VERY comfy! Like I said -these are all small points, but they did add up to let the hotel down. A few tweaks to the fine details would make this a highly enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “A nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: LukeBris90
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights and liked the hotel. Originally I was booked in the sister hotel, Vondel around the corner and upon checkin when we asked for an upgrade to an executive room, they offered us the executive room in the Roemer hotel as they said it was nicer. I have no complaints about my stay. Most of the staff were friendly and helpful. Our room was very nice and spacious with a king bed, small sitting area, spa bath and a total of 3 tv's. We had breakfast included in our price which was ok. As it is a small hotel, I did not expect a huge variety if food but it was still good. As for the location... It is on a quiet little street which is nice although I prefer to be more central (probably in the dam square area) but I guess it is a personal preference. I like the hotel and would recommend it although I probably wouldn't stay here again if i returned to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Executive Room”
Reviews.Author: tinak012
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend trip to Amsterdam - well priced hotel - we bought a package with breakfast included. The room is small - the bed huge. The in room mini bar included is handy - they have 3 jugs of gin- vodka and rum which you can then mix with the cokes/tonics etc from the little fridge. There was a big TV at the end of the bed on the wall and also a smaller TV in the bathroom. The jacuzzi bath is huge and easily fits two people but the bathroom is tiny and the sink is very shallow. All in all - the location is fantastic and the room is ok if all you care about is the bed and the bath - which was my main focus. The breakfast you may want to skip - the service was very slow and no one was clearing away the table so we could sit down so I had to do it. The food on offer wasn't exactly the freshest either. You are much better off going to a cafe nearby. For 260 a night it is fine. The bed did not have a mattress cover which I found slightly odd for a hotel - just a sheet. If they spent some more money on better quality linen it would be better. It is not a 5 star boutique hotel but trying to be. I would rate the hotel - average

Reviews.Title: “Boutique - not for everyone”
Reviews.Author: drb8053
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel largely due to Tripadvisor reviews; I'm not sure we'd stay here again. There was nothing egregiously wrong with the hotel, but I'm not sure "boutique" hotels are for us. Our check-in experience was fine, and our initial impressions of the room and hotel were fine. We thought the shower and sink in the bathroom were stylish, but not very practical (in fact, our stay at this hotel has prompted us to jokingly define "boutique" as "the people who designed this stuff may not have ever actually used it themselves"). The DVD player in our room didn't work properly, which was no big deal in itself, but we were surprised when we called to report it that the hotel had to send out for someone from their "sister hotel" to come and fix it. It was indeed fixed, but the player is oddly located in the coat closet by the room door and in order to pause, ff, rewind, etc, you need to jump up from the bed and point the remote at the player in the closet. Very strange. On checkout, the elevator was not working and they again had to send out for someone from the "sister hotel" to come and fix it. Again, maybe not a huge deal but we were on a timeline to catch a train and had to tell the hotel ourselves that the elevator wasn't working - and then it took some time for the "sister hotel" person to arrive to fix it. We got the impression that there was really only one person in charge at this hotel, who for the vast majority of issues had to call the "sister hotel" for resolution. It seemed to us that, compared to other hotels in Europe at which we stayed on this trip, the Hotel Roemer was skewed a bit low in terms of value for money. Were we to return to Amsterdam, we'd probably look to stay somewhere else (although we thought the location was fine). Don't get me wrong - there was nothing obviously bad or objectionable about the hotel, it's really just an accumulation of small things that make you go "hmm". On the plus side, the hotel embraces an "all-inclusive" concept, which in part means that they provide you with carafes of liquor in your room that are complementary. Now if only they'd picked a decent Scotch...

Reviews.Title: “Location great but....”
Reviews.Author: Mourne
Reviews.Content: This was a small hotel in a side street in Amsterdam. Great location if you don't have a car but a nightmare to park near! The room was ok in size but the safe didn't work nor was it ever repaired to a working condition. Everything seemed to take an age to get right so couldn't recommend staying here

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION VERY GOOD - HOTEL AVERAGE”
Reviews.Author: TRIPPINGTASTE
Reviews.Content: Most of the time the location is even more important of the HOTEL it self and this was the case. Queen's Day in Amsterdam is crazy but I strangely find a room here. I slept in the room at the ground floor, and I think i overpaid a bit since the room was really small, or better not well lay out. You enter the room and you can barely pass to go to the "living" since the bed is set in the wrong direction according to me and it makes only a little path with the wall. The bathroom was not too big but i found the shower pretty good and quite large. The room service was quite good and also i had a nice breakfast at the hotel restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: amyelizabeth94
Reviews.Content: Keeping in mind that this isn't a 5 star hotel, it was a great place to spend a few days in Amsterdam. We loved the location and the room was clean, though a bit on the small side. They no longer have the bikes for rent, but the front desk was so helpful in directing us to a rental place. We didn't do the hotel breakfast as we preferred to check out the city and eat at local cafe's, but it did look good. Because of the location, cleanliness, modern rooms, and friendly staff, we would totally stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed but overall good”
Reviews.Author: LeeBee386
Reviews.Content: When we checked in we were shown to a room on the lower floor that was dreary and depressing. When we objected, though, they did move us a much nicer room and we were happy with the accommodations. The location is excellent. This is basically the museum district and very convenient to the canal district and the nicer parts of the city. Trams are everywhere so you can get to Central station easily if you need to. Breakfast is ridiculously expensive but no different in price than most other hotels. There was a Nespresso machine in our room! So we were quite happy to have coffee in our room and then go out to a cafe. The staff was mixed...some were cold and officious, while others, warm and friendly and helpful. There is a lovely backyard patio where you can sit and read a book and watch the ducks iin a little pond, or socialize and have drinks. So all in all, it's a pleasant, clean, modern, attractively decorated hotel, but I think I'm going to look around for someplace else to stay next time. There a so manychoices iin that area.

Reviews.Title: “Really lovely hotel, just watch out for bikes.”
Reviews.Author: Jimbobimbo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a 4 night city break weekend in September 2011. The hotel is absolutely lovely, very modern and nicely laid out. Can't comment on breakfast as it was Â£20 per person per day for breakfast so we ate out, but if you're all inclusive breakfast is obviously included as are the complimentary spirits in the room, otherwise you pay around Â£3.50 per drink. Our room, number 27, was lovely and quiet and the bed was huge and very comfortable. Patio doors open onto a large balcony, however there is a fire escape that runs down through all the balconys so you couldn't leave the doors open if you left the room/at night for security. The bathroom is amazing, the shower is powerful and the spa bath works great. Even has a flat screen TV in the bathroom. There is a DVD player in the bedroom and coffee maker for expresso, no milk for regular coffee though. The staff were all lovely and were happy to help with any questions. They, like all the dutch, speak fantastic English. There's a lap top in reception you can use for free for internet access. When we arrived we walked from the main station and it took around 30 minutes to get there, but it is a pleasant walk, all be it a bit crowded with a suitcase. I would suggest if you plan to walk it you get a good idea of roads to walk down so you aren't standing outside the station with a map, drawing attention to yourself as a tourist. We walked around the city late at night and never felt threatened or concerned for our safety, as long as you aren't making yourself a target, as in any city, you would be fine. We loved the whole break and if you like walking there is so much to see and the city is easy to navigate with a map which you can get from the hotel. There is a lift in the hotel, but it is painfully slow to arrive. The one problem with the city is it is so packed with bikes, cars, scooters, trams, and taxi bikes it is actually dangerous at times, and you have to constantly check what's around you at junctions. One particular junction I checked and stepped out only to take a girl off her bike completely. No one was injured, but it was a bit of a shock for all concerned, so beware. Apart from that Amsterdam is lovely, we would definately go back and stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but wouldnÂ´t return”
Reviews.Author: FAH79
Reviews.Content: Normal rates are about 150 to 200 EUR, we paid 85 EUR incl. breakfast. A good rate for a hotel in the center of Amsterdam. However the room was extremly small, it bearly had enough space for the bed, so our 3 suitcase did not fit and we had to put them in the Bathroom. Nevertheless the rooms were clean. Staff were not very friendly and did not offer to help us with the luggage. Location of the hotelis very good, near Leidscheplein, vondelpark and the big museums.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business trip”
Reviews.Author: AbuRKJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while attending a conference. Great location and very pleasing aesthetic and amenities made the hotel a terrific home base.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent but beware the cycles”
Reviews.Author: DELondon
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam is definitely a city of cycles. Having almost been mown down twice by the aforesaid two-wheelers on a very wet day at the tail-end of summer, we arrived at the compact five-storey Hotel Roemer. In fact, we were two hours early, so we left our bags with the friendly lady at reception and went in search of a leisurely lunch. Returning after 15:00, we were pleased to discover that we'd been upgraded to a junior suite; not so good was the fact that the inclusive breakfast had disappeared from the booking, although this was quickly rectified. The suite (room #14) was a reasonable size, with a king size bed, a two-persons en suite bathroom (i.e., double sink, double shower and jacuzzi bath), two comfortable leather armchairs, a table and chairs, and a separate dressing area with ample hanging space. This particular suite is on the lower ground floor, with doors onto a terrace with a table and chairs, and stairs up to the garden. If the weather had lived up to the expectations of late August, the extra outside space would have been perfect. Two minor drawbacks of the suite are the low ceiling and the lack of view that one would get (or would have got) with the executive rooms on the upper floors. Other perks include free decanters of gin, vodka and whisky and three flatscreen TVs dotted around the place, including in the bathroom. The room was quiet apart from first thing in the morning when there's plenty of foot traffic from upstairs. Wifi is available in the rooms and works well, but there's an extra charge of six euros for 24 hrs of access. Hotel Roemer's inclusive rate also includes soft drinks, spirits and wine in the comfortable lounge, with bottles open for consumption from 17:00 until bedtime. The 'bites' served afternoon and evening rarely appeared. The interior design of the lounge is commendably up to date, with excellent art work on the walls, chill-out music, and an intriguing, arachnoid ceiling light made from multiple anglepoise lamps. Hotel Roemer has no restaurant as such but there is room service which offers the usual club sandwiches and so on. One restaurant not mentioned in TripAdvisor's 1,147 Amsterdam eateries is 'Joost, eat & drink' in its sister hotel, Hotel Vondel, just around the corner. This scores high with interior design and handsome waiters but the food is only average. Breakfast is served from 7:00 - 11.00 and includes the usual continental options of fruit juices, fresh fruit, cereals, breads, mini croissants, pastries and jams. Bacon, scrambled eggs and sausages are included but they're on a burner. A la carte is also available. There's only a small number of tables so you may find yourself having to wait. Checkout is usually 12:00, but is extendable without charge to 13:00, which fitted well with our flight back to Heathrow at 16:30. Overall, an enjoyable stay and we'd recommend the Hotel Roemer to anyone looking for a gay-friendly, boutique hotel in this thoroughly cosmopolitan and very active city.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy hotel, friendly staff, great bathroom!”
Reviews.Author: suzysuzanne
Reviews.Content: +ve: - The location of the hotel is almost perfect being at walking distance from Leidseplein and Rambrandtplein. - Very friendly staff...very helpful.. always smiling. - The bathroom was amazing! very modern with a Jacuzzi and a shower..and a cool decorative chicken!! -ve: - The housekeeping service is not so good. - The elevator is very slow it's faster to go up the stairs! - Breakfast is not rich so it might be better to have breakfast at a nearby restaurant. Overall, it was a good experience.. would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “The feel of a 4/5* with a personal touch.”
Reviews.Author: srdavies84
Reviews.Content: Originally we were booked into the sister hotel - The Vondel, but were surprisingly told at check in that we were upgraded to the Roemer, which was a minute around the corner. We were in room 17, which overlooked a small decking area. It was plush with a jacuzzi bath, tv in the bathroom, a nespresso machine and very very comfy pillows! The location is great for exploring the museum district, it's near enough to Leidsplein, yet far enough away not to hear any noise. We walked everywhere, didn't use transport at all, apart from to and from Central Station at the start and end. Everything is within easy reach. The staff were friendly and most accommodating. Overall, I would definitely recommend the hotel to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Used To Be A Gem...”
Reviews.Author: P R
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Roemer a number of times over the years, and wanted to give it one more try as we passed through Amsterdam for a few days. When this hotel was first redone, it was not just unique, but a real find in Amsterdam. It was clean, the staff was attentive, the zen garden nice. But now... it appears that someone isn't watching the store. Everywhere we turned, things seems to be worn out and not attended to. Last time we were there, there was one or two ducks out back. Now there are 8, and the duck poop is so thick you can't even walk out back. Get rid of the ducks. The ashtrays with everyone's leftover joints were not cleaned all day. The outdoor furniture, once nicely finished is all weathered, mossy and dirty. The painted floor in the elevator is worn through to the wood, there were cob webs connecting the ceiling lights, the curtains were wrinkled, no place to put toiletries in the shower, not enough hangers, our maid didn't replace our drinking glasses at the bar, there was no one to help with luggage or offer of assistance, the carpets are worn and dirty, the rooms need to be painted, no free wifi. I could go on... but our standards are not unreasonable, it's just clear that the place really needs some attention - especially for the price. Someone isn't doing their job... On the positive side, the free beer tap in the bar was nice, the beds are comfortable, the big jaccuzi tub is a bonus, the single person staff was very nice, and the location is superb. Overall, a very "mixed" bag this time, so we'll be looking for another Hotel next stay.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel on the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: annoukhasselt
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my two kids (14 and 12y) in the roemer during a citytrip in Amsterdam. Choice of hotel was mainly based upon location. And have to say : everything was perfect. The rooms were spotless, the beds were very comfy and staff was really friendly. The hotel is really well located - quiet street but it's only a 5-min walk to all touristy area's. As we were really tired after a day of walking and when rain set in, we decided to head back to the hotel and treat ourselves with roomservice. The food they served was absolutely great (just normal sandwiches but presented in a nice way) and the french fries were almost better than belgian ones. While eating, we watched a DVD (you get them free at the reception). And after diner, a cup of tea (wide variety of tea in your room or downstairs). Only remark : no free wifi - but there is a computer in the lobby that's free to use. But that is really the only remark. We had a wonderful stay and surely will go back there if in Amsterdam again !!!

Reviews.Title: “I saw a mouse... where... there in the dining room”
Reviews.Author: ChangyTheElephant
Reviews.Content: They say that first impressions last, and too be greeted by a mouse scurrying through the dining area and then what could be best described as a breakdown in communication with a surly member of staff, started what was supposed to be a relaxing break into something akin to fawlty towers. After a lengthy discussion with the rather unaccommodating member of staff the cost of moving and shortness of our break forced us to reluctantly stay. The rooms themselves were quite nice but compact and understandably we decided to eat out. Overall, if we hadn't seen the mouse and had the subsequent stand off about the undoubted existence of said animal, then I'd have given this hotel an overall rating of average however due to these factors I can only give it a 'terrible'. Avoid if you have an aversion to furry creatures.

Reviews.Title: “SUPERB !!!”
Reviews.Author: XDCSprog
Reviews.Content: what more can you say.....friendly staff, great location, great rooms (we stayed in room 22) great city ! the staff could not have been more helpful....and having read a few reviews here the only regret i have is that i never knew the minibar was free, and also the decanters of spirits that were left in the room were also free, something i have never experienced before, i was expecting to get stung if i indulged, but hey jump on in....its on the house ! great hotel !!! book it now without any worries !!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: MartinGauthier
Reviews.Content: Very small and secure hotel. The staff is charming. The location is great. My room (room 22) was super clean with a big bed, big bath and a balcony which is rare for Amsterdam. My room was in front of an elevator which scares me a lot, but I didn't hear it open once. You should take the all inclusive package, really worth it. Free drinks, beer, wine, snacks and breakfast. You should rent a bike, cheap and very convenient. The only down side was that you have to pay for the Internet. Come on guys we are in 2011! This should be as free as the TV cable.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Philophrosyne
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a really good location away from the central station and Dam square and in a nicer part of town. The hotel doesn't look much from the outside but much nicer inside. The bar area is excellant sekf service of beer, wine and spirits all complimentary. Near nice bars & restauarants and designer shops. Tram and taxi ranks just across at the square. My room was nice and spacious with a jacuzzi. Only downside was the firm the hotels uses for taxis ripped us off with over charge for a long journey otherwise all good

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lim0r
Reviews.Content: Small little gem in a quiet street but yet just minutes away from the center. room was lovely but a bit noisy on the first floor. on the first morning they had a power shut down and forgot to tell us in advance, we got very upset so they compensated us with a bottle of wine and fruits and later on they upgraded us to a bigger room on the first floor with a balcony. great staff, very very helpful, free internet. Loved this hotel I would stay there again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Atmos99
Reviews.Content: Really great stay at the Roemer. We had an Executive room and it was well proportioned. The bath with Jacuzzi was amazing - Huge! The free mini bar option is great No worries about how much things are, just help yourself. Great!! Only downside was being woken by the mini bar guy, despite the do not disturb being on... It was late morning, but all the same not great. Location a little out of the way, but Amsterdam is so small you are only ever a 15/20 minute walk from wherever you are going. To summarise, really recommend the Roemer, will definitely consider it next time we travel to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Chic Hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Hove-Global-Travel
Reviews.Content: I chose the hotel because it appeared chic and ideally located, and I wasn't disappointed. The hotel is near all the major cultural places of interest. A number of the rooms are small, but all are well-appointed, ideal for a weekend city-break; if staying for longer than a couple of days, suggest you book a larger room. Rather than having breakfast at the hotel, we crossed to the nearby Leidseplein Square, where there're plenty of inexpensive restaurants to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Help yourself bar!”
Reviews.Author: 78gary
Reviews.Content: My wife and i decided to have a short break before christmas. We have both been to Amsterdam many times but have never stayed at Hotel Roemer. The hotel is located on a fairly quiet side street but not too far to all of the main areas of interest. The room was comfortable (although small). The sound proofing between rooms could have been better. The service was very good although the bar included in the price was essentially self service. This suited us fine and it was a great place to relax before heading out for dinner. We ate at De Kas which i would recommend. Overall this hotel was a great place for a relaxed weekend break in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “What looked like a lovely hotel turned into a nightmare on Tuesday this week.”
Reviews.Author: bigfeet24
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed this hotel from Monday the 10th jan till Wednesday 12th. Hotel was found to be lovely and comfortable on the Monday with breakfast on the Tuesday morning in the lounge/dining area filling. However, Tuesday afternoon we decided to kick back an relax around the fire whilst enjoying the provided snacks. To our horror we came across 3 mice within 10mins, one of which decided o climb onto the sofa enroute to provided salmon snacks!!! We reported this to the on duty staff member who said 'YES' we are aware of a mouse problem!!! Thankfully we only had one more night to stay. So looks an be deceiving. Good location though.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel in a great location and friendly staff. Recommended.”
Reviews.Author: teepee2076
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel over Christmas with my boyfriend and we had a lovely stay. The room was a little small but that's because there was a MASSIVE bed. Biggest hotel bed i've ever seen and super comfy. The room was well equipped and we had a nice view into the back yard of the hotel. The room came with free vodka, whiskey and gin in lovely glass bottles and free mini bar ! This was a real treat ! Bath was huge and enough space for 2 rather tall people....the staff were very friendly and helpful with directions etc...breakfast was lovely and also included in our price so we felt it was very good value for money. The location is great because it's very central yet tucked away from main traffic and it's about 10 minutes walk away from the Van Gogh Museum too! Overall lovely stay and we would return there for sure! Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “great concept at hotel roemer”
Reviews.Author: NeilBelfastN/Ireland
Reviews.Content: Just back from frozen weekend , bookended with airport delays and horrible journeys to and from my local airport. But what a great surprise to check in to the hotel roemer on a frozen saturday night, warm welcome and an enviting lounge with real fire and sofa. We booked the all inclusive deal , which included breakfast , the contens of the mini bar and drinks in the lounge. We were celebrating my brothers 40th , so as 2 couples it was great to be able to have a drink before we went out for dinner and then with it being so cold and miserable we could head back to the fireplace and drinks for the craic! The rooms are great (we booked executive rooms) large bed couple of armchairs in a seperate living area wth another tv and the mini bar and coffee machine(nespresso - nice touch) and in the large granite bathroom a jacuzzi , large seperate shower, 2 sinks and another tv! Staff were excellent from breakfast to the receptionist who looked after us for the whole time we stayed (including getting our taxi back to schipol).

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT! WELL PRICED HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: apilling
Reviews.Content: We stayed over on the 5th Dec and found teh hotel tro be expectionally great value for money. The hotel is a small boutique type hotel, great lounge/bar area which looks class. We'd just stayed inteh dylan the night before and although that was in a different class it also cost Â£200 more.. Id recommend the Roemer as a great hotel, easily accessable to the trams and walkable to the amazing shopping /fashion and musuem district. Id defo stay ago - the bed are the comfiest ive ever stayed in and the free bar is great. Breakfast great also!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, needs to sort a few minor issues”
Reviews.Author: SJ13London
Reviews.Content: I booked a small double room, and although the room was indeed small it had been well furnished and thought out, and included plenty of storage space. There's a nice lounge area on the ground floor with sofas and a fire, where guests can help themselves to coffee and cakes in the afternoon, and wine/spirits in the evening. A couple of negative points - there's no free wifi. It seems mean in this day and age to charge for wifi use (I think they charge 6 euro a day). Also, the bathroom was absolutely freezing which made showering really unpleasant. There was a small heater on the ceiling, but this only came on when the light was switched on, and even then it didn't adequately heat the bathroom. Finally, we were woken up one morning by the maids clattering around outside our room. A bit of consideration wouldn't go amiss.

Reviews.Title: “Good but overpriced for what you get”
Reviews.Author: funky_dorper
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 3 nights, 2 of which we had gone for the double bubble package on their website. Unfortunately we had to ask them for the champagne that was included in our package and we did not get the slippers and bubble bath as is meant to be included aswell! Not very good service!!! The spirits in the room had enough in the bottles for only 2 drinks of each and we had to ask 3 times for these to be refilled. The mini bar was very basic - 2 beers, 2 cokes, 2 diet cokes, 2 oj, 2 tonic water, peanuts and pringles. On ourlast day the mini bar was not topped up at all. We went for the all inclusive package so all this was included in the price as well as drinks in the bar downstairs. We did sit downstairs a couple of times but felt a bit awkward as it is self service and the white wine bottles were only half full so when we had a glass each we had to move to something else. We just felt for the price that they were rather stingy on the things that are meant to be included. I would have rather spent less on a room and gone to a bar elsewhere and paid for the drinks. The room was nice, the bed was super comfy. The jacuzzi was great, although there is a heater in the bathroom that can't be turned off so would get too hot in the bathroom within a couple of minutes. Cleanliness in the lobby was great, although our room was a bit disappointing. There was dust all over the back of both tvs, hairs in the bath and the shower didn't look like it had been cleaned that well. Our first night we had a bath and the next day after the daily clean the was still water on the side of the bath. We weren't impressed at all as we both work in the industry and run a Bed and Breakfast in UK and know what standards to expect. The breakfast was ok, there was a menu that was pretty basic. No muesli just a couple of cereals. I ordered two poached eggs and when they came they were hard and awful - I am a chef and know it is not hard to poach an egg! The feeling at breakfast was rather sterile and no one was very friendly - which is a shame it's nice to have someone that looks like they enjoy their job and likes talking to guests. The staff were nice and professional but once again very sterile. Overall I wouldn't stay here again for what it cost us, for Â£200 a night I think there would be plenty of other better options.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Boutique”
Reviews.Author: Jean_Marie40
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem! The executive room we stayed in absolutely lovely - the jacuzzi bath was just what we needed after touring the city for 5 hours. It is also true that no extras are added to the bill. Great location!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely area to stay in. Perfect rooms with all mod cons”
Reviews.Author: Boowiki
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Roemer to celebrate 10/10/10! Shuttle bus from Schipol dropped us off at the Hotel for 15 euros each which is a very good deal. Staff were very helpful with every question and demands and were always friendly. We were given the basement room which at first we thought was going to be awful, but the room was really nice. We had two windows (which did not open) but very efficient air conditioning. The bed was huge and the room included a TV, DVD and Ipod docking station with speakers which was a bonus! The bathroom also was fabulous with a twin shower, jacuzzi bath and TV. One of the best touches was the bottles of Whisky, Gin and Vodka with just enough in each for a couple of glasses which I thought was a great idea. The coffee machine was also a top notch tassimo type with a wide variety of coffee cartridges with others available from reception. One evening when we came back to the hotel we went to the bar and noticed nobody was serving, that was because you basically help yourself, so I had a vodka coke and my partner had a lovely glass of wine. I think the whole experience has been very enjoyable and if I am ever visiting Amsterdam again, I hope that I get to stay at the Roemer.

Reviews.Title: “A nice little boutigue hotel, which I can highly recommend.”
Reviews.Author: tanja00
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying in this little hotel and would definitely stay here again. However, some of the rooms are not great (in the basement) so please be aware of this when you book a room. Breakfast could have been better. Even I can do poach eggs better! Several things on the menu were also not available. Room service was very good!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was brilliant - wouldn't want to stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: cricky66
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. I travelled with my partner and his parents and as a group we didn't have single bad thing to say. Firstly, our room was lovely - comfy beds, 3 tvs, jacuzzi bath and rain shower, artwork on the walls, not to mention the free mini-bar which contained beer, soft drinks and nuts, there was also vodka, gin and whisky in decanters. The Nespresso coffee machine in the room was a treat too - really good proper coffee. The staff were really friendly and helpful for our whole stay, the rooms were also cleaned every day. The breakfast was lovely - fruit, yoghurts, cereals, bacon, sausage and a special breakfast menu. The outside garden was an added bonus, really calm and peaceful. Location excellent - it's on a quiet street just off Leidesplein :-) We had an excellent stay for our 3 nights and this will always be our first choice of stay for any future visits to Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, with a few minor quirks.”
Reviews.Author: Lovecraft
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel, in a quiet street, but not far from the interesting places. We booked the junior suite, a spacious but not huge room in the top (3rd) floor. I thad 3 (albeit small) TV's, a huge bathroom with a jacuzzi (one of the TV's was here) and a very nice shower. Wireless internet was available for â‚¬6 for 24 hours, I think. All the good things you can read about this hotel in Tripadvisor are true, so I'm just going to mention a few quirks, so they can improve (I wrote the same thing on their survey). The interiors of the wardrobes, and some of the ornaments were very dusty. The bathroom floor had feet marks on it, as the sink had soap marks on it. I think that probably this kind of marble is difficult to clean, but this is not an excuse to leave it stained. The breakfast was good, but I ordered fried eggs, and one of the eggs was broken (had its yolk mixed with the white). I good chef would have discarded this eggs and prepared new ones. The second day I was served perfect fried eggs. I ordered rosti (potatos, it was in the menu). The first day they said they ran out of it. Fair enough. But the second day they told me that rosti was actually toast, and that I could have it from the buffet. Nonsense. Free minibar was included in my room, but the second day they didn't restock it, so I had to ask for it twice, and the drinks were warm when they finally arrived. Obviously these are minor things and they would not stop me from coming back if I have the chance. I would recommend this hotel to everynoe.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel, in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: travelcanuck29
Reviews.Content: We booke dthe vondel hotel, but were upgraded to the Hotel Roemer. Thse two hotels are located in close proximity to each other. The location is fantastic, with a nearby tram stop, and easy walking distance to the Van Gogh Museum, Heineken brewery, canal boat tour stop, and Vondel Park. It was nice to be a little off the heavily travelled streets, but easy walking distance to everything. Clean, modern rooms, with an excellent concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal city hotel”
Reviews.Author: stancy48
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly situated in a quiet side street in easy walking distance of the Rijksmuseum and the heart of Amsterdam. The bedrooms were comfortable, the bathrooms good, the staff extremely helpful and it was lovely to have a garden to sit in. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent boutique hotel close to everything”
Reviews.Author: theshoemaker
Reviews.Content: I must say that style-wise, the hotel seems a bit nicer in pictures, or alternatively we were simply unlucky with our room which was not warm and light like in many of the photos, but perhaps a bit overly trendy with a huge bright red wall. It was also very small for a junior suite even in big city standards, this being their largest room option. that said, it provided a comfortable stay and the service was always excellent. We were pleasantly surprised when our rate included breakfast and complimentary food and drinks throughout our stay. The lobby is cozy and the patio is really nice. One downside was the fact that from 7AM onwards, we could smell grease in our 3rd floor room. I assume this was from the kitchen as they were preparing breakfast, but why it came all the way to our room, I don't know. Another minor downside was the fact that the only way to enter the hotel is by ringing a door bell, after which they ask for both your room number and last name which you need to yell on the street. this is a bit awkward, if they want to be so secure, why not have a system where you can open the main door with a room key? overall, I found the hotel to be quite pleasant, and the pricing through Tablet was reasonable. the location is pretty good, a quick walk from a number of places but just far enough from the chaotic Leidseplein.

Reviews.Title: “a good small hotel”
Reviews.Author: thomho
Reviews.Content: We liked the location, the tie in with nearby hotel Vondel for an excellent dinner, a good breakfast at the Roemer, the design of the hotel, drinks included in the room rate and helpfulness of the staff We however thought given the somehwat smaller size of room it might have been better to provide a smaller double bed to create more walk around space in the room Some minor flaws which however were quickly remedied after we asked were only on etowel for two people and a room safe that initially did not work These things can happen in any establishement;what is important is how quickly they get fixed and on that score we were quite happy

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: mfaracirn
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. It was within walking distance to everything, but far away not to be too noisy. It is all inclusive, comes with alcohol :-), light snacks and breakfast every morning. Cute garden and friendly staff. On recommendation is not to stay in the room next to kitchen though!

Reviews.Title: “Well maintained, clean, botique hotel”
Reviews.Author: jili12
Reviews.Content: Situiated on a nice quiet street in a nice location, Hotel Roemer is a small but friendly hotel. Rooms are large, with ample size bathrooms. The rooms were exceptionally clean. Their backyard garden was a nice place to relax with a drink after a long day of exploring the city. Located near some of the best museums in the city. Did not use their Breakfast service. Some rooms are below grade but have windows that supply sufficient light.

Reviews.Title: “I didn't want to leave...”
Reviews.Author: FCA_10
Reviews.Content: The staff could not have been nicer, the location was exceptional and the room was clean, quiet and very comfortable. The outdoor terrace was an added bonus. When I travel to Amsterdam again, I will definitely book this hotel. It really was remarkable!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous”
Reviews.Author: LinsayGB
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend at the hotel to celebrate my fiance's birthday. The room was lovely with an extremely comfortable and enormous bed! We had a balcony overlooking the hotel's garden which was peaceful and pretty. The hotel is about 30 minutes by taxi from the airport and close to the Vondel Park and to the museum area and Amstrdam's "Bond Street" It is small and very individual with a welcoming atmosphere and very helpful staff, who assisted us with a very good restaurant for Saturday night's dinner. We plan to go back and stay there on our honeymoon, so can't give much higher praise than that!

Reviews.Title: “Staying in Amsterdam, the best bits!”
Reviews.Author: Sair9951
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Roemer last year for our first trip to Amsterdam and it is only now on returning from a bad stay with another hotel in Amsterdam that I realised I should have written a great review for this hotel on my return last year! Hotel Roemer is perfect for people who like to stay in the far less tourist specific areas - the hotel is in a really lovely part of Amsterdam, but a easy, short walk to the main centre, shopping (which is awesome), restaurants and sites. Amsterdam really is a very pretty city and staying with the Hotel Roemer will enhance any trip - with fabulous staff, generous and well styled rooms, the inviting guest bar and outdoor terrace area is a very nice touch! We will definatley be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly/helpful staff, great rooms!”
Reviews.Author: smarcela
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our 3 night stay at the Roemer. Extremely close to Vondel Park, the major museums, the Leidsplein, good resturants and great shopping. The rooms were quiet and very comfortable. The breakfast was delicious! The staff was very helpful and gave us great tips on what to do. The front desk arranged a boat rental for us and gave us directions to just about everyplace we wanted to visit. Another bonus are the in house Vespa and bike rentals which every guest should take advantage of! DEFINATELY A GREAT PLACE TO STAY IN A LOVELY CITY WITH THE FRIENDLIEST PEOPLE WE HAVE EVER MET TRAVELING!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Roemer is truly a boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Dewtrell
Reviews.Content: I have been meaning to write a review since our stay in November 2009. My husband and I were on our honeymoon and we booked 3 nights at Hotel Vondel (sister property). Upon arrival, we were early so our room was not ready. We walked into for a couple of hours, had lunch only to return and discover we were upgraded to a junior suite at Hotel Roemer, located around the corner. The front desk manager personally walked us over to the hotel and we were impressed. Granted, Hotel Vondel looked wonderful as well, but Roemer was definitely a step above. When we were shown to our room, we were just in awe. While smaller than most hotel rooms (this is Europe), the room was one of the most modern and luxurious rooms I've stayed in. The bathroom was amazing with a wonderful shower and jet tub, we also had a balcony which would would have liked to enjoyed if it weren't so cold Considering we booked Hotel Vondel for $149 a night, we could not have been more pleased. The staff was very helpful. There is a computer in the lobby to use for free and even a bar. The only complaint is the breakfast buffet. It looked wonderful but, if I remember correctly, the cost was outrageous, something like $50 dollars per person - I've paid less than that at the Ritz Carlton in Singapore. However, I'm not going to go on a rant about such a minor thing - I'd rather enjoyed the pancakes at one of the many pancake houses in Amsterdam. The hotel is a little walk from the city center but it truly is not that bad. Staying at Hotel Roemer made me feel like I was a local - and truly, Amsterdam is so small, you're not too far from anything.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: mrssmith1901
Reviews.Content: We decided to take a wee break to Amsterdam for out Honeymoon, and I loved the look of the Hotel Roemer straight away. I certainly was not disappointed. The immediate impression of the hotel was just amazing, it's gorgeous. The staff just bent over backwards to please, they are so friendly & polite. I absolutely loved my stay here & will be booking again!

Reviews.Title: “A mixed review but I did love the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: foreman41
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying I would stay here again I did like the Hotel a lot BUT my room was in the basement and although quite big for european standards (Huge bathroom big jacuzzi and double rain showers) the fact you are in the what was the cellar made the views out as you can quess a little limiting. It was an Executive room number 15 but being below ground and right under the hotel reception made it quite noisey at times, if I stay there again I would ask for an upper floor room for sure. The location is great, shops and resturants are all walking distance, but the centre of the city is about 25 min walk away which to my mind is no big deal you see so much more when you walk. The tram stop anyway is only a block away. The staff where very helpful friendly and I liked the free drinks and snacks. I did think it a little over priced but thats Amsterdam I guess. Overall I enjoyed my two night stay a the Hotel but next time I would get a upper floor room for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Good boutique hotel, in nicer area.”
Reviews.Author: JLS813
Reviews.Content: This hotel has all you need if you plan to be out and about in Amsterdam. It is a far walk from the central station, but that means it is in a much nicer, cleaner, and safer area than the main city center. There are great restaurants and bars within walking distance, like the Hard Rock, Dutch and Irish Pubs, and lots of Asian and Italian Restaurants. It is very dutch style with small hallways and steep stairs, but we found that charming. The rooms are more spacious than many boutique hotels, and the bathrooms are huge. Though the bathroom was not entirely clean, meaning soap scum and scuff marks (but not meaning unhygienic clean), I enjoyed the large tub, great rain shower, and TV in the bathroom. The free drinks, cocktails, and coffee in the lounge were a nice treat as well, and the out door area looked lovely. As usual with these hotels, the front desk person was not the most out going, but check in and check out were prompt and easy. Our dogs were tolerated, and we always appreciate that.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel at an ok price”
Reviews.Author: Banko-DK
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel 5 times or so during 2008 and 2009. Really enjoy their decorations of the rooms and the very stylish bar area. The rooms vary a lot in size so you can be lucky to get one of the better rooms, but I believe they usually sell them at a higher price (as junior suites or the like). Free minibar is included in the stay and it is well stocked, and should you miss anything feel free to go down to the bar and get a free drink. It is a nice hotel and if you book in advance you can get ok rates, but I would say there are better deals avaliable in Amsterdam center if you are travelling on a budget. Positive: Cool interiour Free minibar Free bar Great atmosphere Perfect location - next to Leidseplan (bar/cafe area), Vondelpark (green park) and the shopping district in Amsterdam Small hotel (less then 30 rooms I believe) Negative: Mediocore staff Sometimes a bit overpriced Average breakfast (below average for a hotel in this league)

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Philip_L_Meehan
Reviews.Content: This hotel has it all. Style, Elegance, Value, Location and a fully stocked and inclusive room bar!! What more can I say! I still don't think the night manager forgave us for trying to catch his ducks at 7am!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Andrew038
Reviews.Content: Running the usual gauntlet with internet, you never really know what you are going to get but this hotel exceeded our expectations. The location was great because personally we didn't want to be at the heart of the red light district and tourist schmaltz! It is 2 minutes walk from Leidseplein which has lots of bars and restaurants as well as being located very near to the Van Gogh Museum and easily walkable to the Anne Frank House. People that moaned on here about the size of the rooms really should realise that this is Amsterdam and not New York - the buildings are naturally smaller people! The rooms are well equipped and the bed and bathroom were very good, we were only sorry it was too cold to expereince the balcony. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful and really couldn't do enough for us. I would definitely recommend this hotel if you are planning sight seeing but maybe not one for the lads stag do!

Reviews.Title: “A great all inclusive hotel, but a little out of the way.”
Reviews.Author: matt_from_nottingham
Reviews.Content: We spent a couple of nights in Amsterdam late in October and decided to stay here after treating ourselves to the Toren last time around. This is a little out of the way, but the excellent tram network soon got us here from central station. An excellent value combined ticket was worth the short queue at the airport tourist information. It was a fair sized room with balcony, made all the better by the advanced champagne deal on the website with all inclusive drinks at the bar. This was help yourself bottles of wine, this had to get messy. There are quite a few nice places: shops, restaurants etc and the park to visit all in this area. A Wagamamas is just over the canal for a great meal on a budget. Would I stay here again? Probably if the Toren was booked up or too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT”
Reviews.Author: dervin
Reviews.Content: This is by far one of the nicest little hotels we have stayed in. Clean, convenient, great location. It's a converted apartment/flat in a real nice residential area. The park two blocks back is nice to walk through, even in the winter. The breakfast was great and the desk clerks were very helpful. The only negative we had was that they ordered us a cab back to the airport (they must contract with a company because it was the same company that picked us up with the package we booked and told us the price. It was more, we just didn't tip the driver. If you want a really good Italian restaurant within walking distance go to Trattoria Toto. It's around the corner. Turn right out of the hotel then right on Constantijn Huygenstraat. Cross the street, it's about one block down.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Moumouthor
Reviews.Content: The staff is exceptionally friendly and they recommended us the best restaurant we have never been into (sorry I dont remember its name). We had an upgrade while checking in, which is always nice, and the room and the bathroom were really gorgeous.What else? There is a free Nespresso cofee machine in the room and an ipod/iphone station. We were really glad we booked this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “A boutique hotel with friendly service for luxury and style seekers on a 4-star budget”
Reviews.Author: CouplefromSydney
Reviews.Content: We started our trip in Amsterdam by walking to Hotel Roemer from the train station. It took us about 25 minutes to walk. Needless to say, we were exhausted by the time we arrived at the hotel. However, the approach to the hotel was enough to relax and refresh us! The hotel is located in a rizy part of town and is surrounded by a variety of other boutique properties as well as homes that probably belong to upper- middle and upper class locals. Vondelpark is very close. Hotel Roemer is a quiet, modern, boutique hotel which offers great value in the form of an all-inclusive deal. This deal includes mini bar, alcohol, afternoon tea, evening canapes, and breakfast. The minibar includes snacks (chips, nuts etc), water, juice, cola etc. These were replenished at least once a day. The alcohol deal includes vodka, scotch and gin. The all-inclusive deal is sort of like an executive club deal without there being an executive floor. The breakfast was good (depending on what you ordered) and the staff were very helpful. Location was ideal as it was close to the hustle and bustle (including a Hard Rock cafe that served margaritas; a drink that we are very partial to!) yet far enough to be classified as a very quiet hotel. Despite various wonderful attractions and destinations in Amsterdam, we would say that Hotel Roemer was actually the highlight of our stay in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Good, but could be much better.”
Reviews.Author: cmdenny
Reviews.Content: We were moved here when the Hotel Vondel had double booked our online booking. We were shown initially a not great room (long and narrow with bed not in line of site to window) - but were then put in a basement suite - the steps walked up to the back garden and small duck pond. Room really nice - great facilities - 3 tellys dotted around room, and nice jaquizi bath. Downside was the slightly musty smell and also the poor house cleaning. Bedding and sheets immaculate, but the marbel table and bath could have been cleaned better. I found the service of reception mixed, with the person who initially booked us in a little less than I would have expected. Hotel on the whole was good, and really relaxed feel as only 20ish rooms. Local to museums, and if you are looking for a breakfast (we decided against â‚¬20 per person breakfast and booze supplement) - walk down Leidsplat (prob spelt wrong) and cross a couple of canals for a great bakery on the right hand side. Would recommend - and would say if they got the cleaning and service right this would be an absolute gem of a place - I would give it another go.

Reviews.Title: “lucked into this hotel when their sister hotel was full”
Reviews.Author: dunnyboo
Reviews.Content: We had booked a room online with their sister hotel. When we got there we were told it was full so they moved us to this one and upgraded our room (it is literally right around the corner). We thought it was a great hotel and experienced none of the rudeness another review on this hotel wrote about. The room was small but cozy, and the bed was huge and comfortable! The room was cleaned adequately everyday. My only criticism was that our price did not include breakfast for which they charged 25 euro. Needelss to say we didn't eat there! That is my only criticism! It was in a fantastic spot...quiet yet about a 5 minute walk to Leidseplein Square, 15 minute walk to Heineken brewery and Van Gogh and Rijks museums. I highly recommend this hotel! p.s. the hotel also has air conditioning which was not advertised but being as we were there in the middle of a hot spell...it was definitely a plus!

Reviews.Title: “Obtuse surly staff, broken appliances and furniture, grubby decor.”
Reviews.Author: TDBDS
Reviews.Content: This may have been a great boutique hotel once but is in need of decoration a thorough clean and better maintenance. Booked all inclusive garden room. The garden was neglected and some of the furniture broken, the empty beer bottle that was in the garden outside our room on arrival was still there on our last day. Beer and soft drinks in the reception area were included in room price but the only bottle opener was broken and was advised by staff had been for weeks - no one could nip out and buy one? Luckily another guest provided a bottle opener. i pod dock provided in room had no plug,when I advised reception they asked if I was sure and to go and check again! Since there was a lot of dust on and around dock I declined. I had read the other reviews before I booked and knew it was small it is tiny and I wish the staff everyone raved about were on duty when we stayed. Beds were very comfortable and the hotel is very close to museum district and not too far from cafes/shops etc Amsterdam is beautiful, relaxed and friendly and you'll have a great time if you don't stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A charming hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: RSJCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Though quiet and secluded, this charming hotel is within walking distance of major museums. The staff are unfailingly helpful and friendly. The buffet breakfast, included, which is varied and adequate, is a welcome amenity, as are the afternoon snacks. There is a computer in the lobby for internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Style over Substance”
Reviews.Author: jooly63
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 top rate rooms with jacuzzi bath but only got one, number 21, the other, no. 19 could barely fit the bed in and no bath only a shower. When we queried this were told that the hotel was full even though our booking was made in July 2008. We made up for it however in the cosy lounge by decimating the all inclusive bar and nibbles. Our stay was completely spolit by the rude indifference of the sole waiter at breakfast who ignored any waiting guests and got shirty when I asked could I sit at a recently vacated table. He eventually tidied it up but then made us wait ages before taking our food order. The cereal bowls and yogurts ran out and when our "cooked breakfast" eventually arrived we were greeted with odd bits of bacon piled onto a saucer! We couldn't get out of the hotel fast enough after that and felt ripped off at having to pay 219 euros a night for such appalling service.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, but the logistics are terrible”
Reviews.Author: EuroAmeroScott
Reviews.Content: When my wife arrived to check-in to our Delux Room, she was surprised to be shown the way toward the basement. The room was literally underground with a window that looked at the feet of passersby... When my wife refused the room, she was told that the only room they had 'above-ground' was very small. Indeed, a double bed and not even a lounge chair could fit in the room. Oh well, they promised us a better room for night 2. I went to make myself a coffee in the room's Nespresso machine only to find an already opened sugar packet and sugar all over the tray -- housekeeping? Then there was breakfast. As mentioned by others previously, the hotel breakfast area can only sit about 12 people -- the rest have to wait. And yet the waiter makes no effort to greet you and help you understand the situation. People just stand there wondering if there are other tables somewhere else they don't know about.... When we did sit down, the service was terrible. The first words the waiter said to me after we had been in the room for 10 minutes already and I asked for a cup of tea was "Wait, I'll be there in a minute". Lovely... What more? No remote control for the TV in the next room, heat that was either too weak or too strong, housekeeping personnel in the hallways that make absolutely no effort to greet you when they see you, wrong instructions from the front desk, need I go on? The decor and amenities of the hotel truly are lovely. Nonetheless, the bad service killed it for us. We were happy to leave.

Reviews.Title: “You will do very well to beat this hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Spanner1968
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a valentine weekend break in Amsterdam and staying at the Hotel Roemer was an absolute pleasure , I would recommend this hotel to anyone! If you feel like splashing out a bit , the junior suite is superb, suer clean, modern, the comfiest beds on the planet , luxury all round.. The breakfast is good, and service was super, and if you are lucky enough to get the inclusive bar deal and the lounge in front of the fire to yourself , you wont want to go out on the town! the location is perfect and very quiet and just round the corner from the museum area and a few mins from town centre All round excellent stay,

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel except for the noise”
Reviews.Author: westcoaster49
Reviews.Content: Hotel Roemer in Amsterdam is one of those gems that, at first glance seemes perfect: comfortable rooms, exceptional service, great ambience....except..this diamond is flawed...and unfortunately for the Hotel Roemer, the flaw is nothing they can solve. The problem is the Friday and Saturday night yahoos that reel out of the pubs at 1 or 2 in the morning and seem to find it necessary to scream, shout, sing their way home. I would definitely stay here again but make sure that it was not on a weekend. The location is both a plus and a minus. You're handy to Amsterdam Centraal with its shopping and restaurants and to Vondel Park, but also close to the nightlife. On the plus side, the service is terrific (thanks, Fernanda) and knowledgeable, the rooms are clean and include an i-pod dock, and the breakfast is very decent. All in all, a treasure of a hotel...just not on the weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Special Birthday Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Cappy2108
Reviews.Content: I spent many hours on Trip Advisor and the forum trying to find the right hotel for my husbands surprise 50th birthday trip. I eventually settled on Hotel Roemer and found a great deal on Laterooms.com. I requested a 'nice' room explaining the circumstances but didn't hold out much hope. We had a great flight with Easyjet and arrived on time. The train to Central Station was also faultless but the taxi ride was something else! We ended up sharing with another couple and drove all round the houses for what was in effect a 5 min journey and all for 20 euro! The hotel was in a great location next to Vondel Park. On arrival at the hotel we were given a welcome drink and plate of hors d'oeuvres whilst booking in and shown a map of the area. The receptionist was very friendly and extremely helpful, showing us all the sites and promising to find us a good Seafood restaurant. We were shown to our room and we found we had been upgraded to a superb room...... a spa bathroom, sitting area, 3 TVs, large bed and doors to the garden. The room contained decanters of complimentary spirits and also a free mini bar. There was plenty of storage space and the bathroom contained everything you could wish for-hairdryer, scales, towels, smellies, etc etc. The public area of the hotel had a nice relaxing atmosphere with comfy chairs and free drinks and snacks from 5pm. There was internet available which we used quite a lot. We hardly saw anyone else during our stay and it was very quiet. The receptionist booked a table for us at Lucius which we loved. The only slight complaint was that the room was a bit noisy in the morning as it was by the kitchen but it didn't bother us too much as the smell of bacon made up for it! Breakfast was ok but not great and we had no trouble getting a seat overlooking the garden. All in all a great stay and the staff couldn't have done enough for us.

Reviews.Title: “Good but a bit sloppy”
Reviews.Author: Cilantro_and_Lime
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Roemer was the final leg of our month-long excursion to Europe. We stayed in room 34, on the top floor which sold itself as a Junior Suite. The room was large and contained a small couch and table, so I guess that might be considered a suite? I'm not sure what the standard definition of a suite is, but for Amsterdam the room was large. I agree with the other reviews that the staff was incredibly relaxed and friendly. Offering a welcome drink seems to be the standard these days, but the hotel has an all-inclusive bar which made the place feel a bit like home. I enjoyed sitting down to a relaxing drink at the end of a very full day. We encountered a couple of problems, which for the price, were inexcusable because from other reviews, they seem to be recurring. First, for the first four mornings, the staff kept asking us for our confirmation to make sure that breakfast was included. I eventually emailed back the reservation to the hotel to clear things up. Second was the way that they handled breakfast. There aren't enough spaces for all the guests to eat at once, which is fine, but they don't have an orderly system to seat people when it's busy. Clearly a foreseeable problem. [We were directed to wait on the couches until a place was available, only to have other guests seat themselves at dirty tables. I was told by the staff that they didn't want to insult these people by telling them to wait, and instead chose to insult the rest of us who were already waiting. (I sound like an old geezer, don't I?) ] All of this leads me to the conclusion that the place is disorganized; management ought to know that the problem exists but chooses to ignore what a few simple changes would fix. It's just sloppy. No matter how friendly the service may be, for $625 a night, I expect much, much better.

Reviews.Title: “Absolut Perfect”
Reviews.Author: GonsoSpain
Reviews.Content: We just landed from AMS in Madrid after spending a beutifull weekend. Our best choice was this hotel. It is quiet in a very nice neigborhood, very convinient for visiting the museums and close to the cemtrum. The staff is perfect. They are pofesional and trained to make your stay pleasent. This is a boutique hotel so don't expect large rooms, meeting rooms, etc. This is its beuty. Everything is design to make your experience different. Thank you to Roemer for delivering such experience.

Reviews.Title: “Roemer ncie but not totally convincing”
Reviews.Author: thetravelbug_8
Reviews.Content: We just spent a wonderful weekend in Amsterdam at the Roemer. The location was excellent- near everything but on a quiet side street. Our room was nice although it was in the basement. We liked all the little details: a small flatscreen TV in the bathroom, and ipod dock, a well stocked bar in the room, nespresso and tea in the room. Our only complaint was the breakfast. There is a ala carte breakfast but it seemed quite disorganized. There were not enough tables for all the guests so we waited for a table. Once we were sitting it took almost an hour for our food to come. When the food finally arrived it was average quality, not bad. On a positive note the breakfast room is lovely with a nice view on the courtyard. All in all we liked the Roemer but are not sure we'll go back the next time we're in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Very smart with extras adding something special”
Reviews.Author: CarnarvonBoy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little away from the centre of town but an easy walk and more pleasant to be away from the typical Amsterdam party scene. The hotel was small and not all rooms are perfect but after a couple of moves we ended up in a perfect room. What made the stay however was the little extras, a nice nespresso coffee machine in each room, free coffee in the bar area and free wine and beer between certain times in the lounge. Although not worth much financially it was great to not have to worry that every thing you wanted during your stay was going to be an extra on the bill. There was even a decanter in the room included in the rate. Overall a great spot, close but not surrounded, and with a feeling of a very classy boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel Roemer”
Reviews.Author: LFarndell
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just got back from an amazing bank holiday weekend in Amsterdam. We wanted to stay somewhere with a boutique feel, and for us it came down to Banks Mansion and Hotel Roemer. As we were already pushing the boat out, and we had found a deal that made Roemer a bit cheaper, we plumped for the latter. So glad we did! Got the train from the airport to central station and found the tram which takes you to Leidseplein. Total cost was about 8.5 euros each compared to about 40 euros from the airport and probably took about the same amount of time. Tram is a great way to get about and get a feel for where you are. Found the hotel easily and was immediately made to feel at home with a glass of wine. After booking in and getting an amazing room upgrade (still not quite sure how we managed that!) we settled in to the suite (room 14) in the basement. I have read reviews about this room, and you definitely have to realise that even though the room is amazing and massive, the trade off is that its under the main eating area and therefore prone to noise. Not quite sure how as there are so many thick rugs up in the breakfast/bar area. Earplugs and large nightcaps sorted out this problem for us. We certainly can't complain as we got the suite upgrade for free, but I would imagine if you were paying for the extra room, you may be a bit disappointed with the noise. But I hope that doesn't put people off as it was still the best room i've ever stayed in. Great double rain shower, double jacuzzi bath, walk in wardrobe, huge bed (but two singles on a king frame), 3 tv's, nespresso, private access to the garden. Unfortunately the DVD player didn't work. The staff are all very friendly, and I have to agree with other reviewers that it is sometimes a bit chaotic, especially at breakfast time. If its busy you may not get served for a while, so make sure you help yourself to the bits that are out. We weren't sure on the first day whether to help ourselves to drinks etc, but soon learnt that this is the best way of getting on with things there. Treat the place a bit like home from home and it will make it all a lot easier! Cleaning staff are ok, but a bit hot and cold. We liked to take a glass or two of wine down with us when we got back in the evening and by the end of the 3 night stay we had about 10 wine glasses with us! But otherwise it was always spotless. Great location for Van Gogh and Reiksmuseum. Vondelpark is a great place to spend a few chilled hours and the restaurant under the film museum there is a definite recommendation. Would also recommend the canal bus as well. Great way of learning about the canals and seeing the city. All in all an amazing weekend in a perfect hotel. Can highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend to remember”
Reviews.Author: paulandjacqui
Reviews.Content: We, my fiancÃ© and I, stayed in this lovely hotel for the weekend, the weather was terrible however it did not seem to bother us. And it was all thanks to the wonderful people and atmosphere in this hotel. We had the normal 2-person chamber, but there was nothing normal to it. The whole decoration was stylish and very comfortable. We had all we need it! I want to say thanks to the persons working at the Roemer Hotel for making this a weekend to remember!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Roemer every time.”
Reviews.Author: AReillyLondon
Reviews.Content: WOW! I cannot recommend this hotel enough. My husband & I spent 3 nights here for our anniversary and we shall be returning the first chance we get. I'm not sure why other reviewers complained about the staff, we found them extremely helpful, friendly and very knowledgeable about A'dam. The garden is lovely to relax in after a day of touring the city, the free drinks and bar snacks are also a nice touch. We stayed in room 14 which is in the basement, but with stairs leading to the garden area. Our first impression was magical as when we opened the door to the garden a duck and six ducklings waddled in front of us. They became our pets for the few days as they were living on the pond in the garden. The room is very large and the bed enormous. As for the bathroom WOW again! The shower area has two showers and is large enough for 4-6 people. The jaccuzzi bath is huge too, my husband is 6'4 and could very comfortably relax in it. The food is excellent at the hotel. The breakfast is included and is delicious. We missed b'fast a couple of times so ordered room service meals which were very large portions and also delicious. Pick this hotel if you want a romantic break or even if you have children, the garden is a great area for them to run around in.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic, young, and hip”
Reviews.Author: toujours1
Reviews.Content: I booked the Hotel Roemer for 1 night in order to celebrate my birthday in style (was in Netherlands for work, and wanted to live it up!) Had seen the hotel featured in a British mag as a "must see hotel" in Europe, and the price seemed reasonable. I loved it all: the location in the charming Vonderpark area, the greeting (although I was a bit surprised by the 'would you like a drink' question as I was doing the check in!), the room, and, of course, the all-inclusive mini-bar and happy hour!! I have never seen this included in a hotel package, and what a treat it was! About the happy hour: wine, snacks, beer, soda Ã  gogo in a cute intimate environment ALL included! About the room: Good size, lovely large bed (althogh why seperated by two seperate covers? So hard to cuddle!), fashionable yet understated deco, and A NESPRESSO MACHINE next to the bed. What else? The bathroom was also lovely: stone sinks that dry quickly, jacuzzi, shower, lovely shampoos/conditioners, and a hairdryer that acutally dries your hair! Just one small piece of advice: you must put the "do not disturb' sign on the door if you do not want them walking in on you with water, candies, or just to ask if you want any drinks. Nice service, but maybe a wee bit much! In any case, I very highly recommend this hotel, by FAR the best I know in Amsterdam. Just don't reserve on Spendia.com, as they take a 40â‚¬ comission!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I Have Stayed In... EVER!”
Reviews.Author: Greenmnky2
Reviews.Content: Hotel Roemer was by far the best hotel I have had the pleasure to stay in. My husband and I visited Amsterdam as the last stop on a whirlwind European honeymoon. By the time we landed in Amsterdam, both of us were sick as dogs. Head cold that moved into our chest.... it was miserable. But being sick in that hotel was wayyyy better than even being sick at your own home. The beds were perfect and cozy, there were two flat screen tv's you could watch from the bed. One for the hubby, and one for me! A mini fridge that was stocked with things a normal human would want to eat. There was a coffee (nespresso) machine in our room. There was a rainfall shower, and a jacuzzi tub that had an amazing view of.... a flat screen tv in the bathroom! I have read quite a few reviews of Hotel Roemer online. A lot of people mentioned the fact that they get their room service food from their other hotel across the street. Hubby and I were so sick, we only left the hotel to get food once. Every other meal was room service. (Side note here... when I get sick, I get PICKY about what I eat! I'm a sensitive creature.) I had not one complaint about the food. They brought us every extra condiment, utensil, and plate we could have possibly needed, and then left us to enjoy our meals. And the hotels happy hour!!!
