I don't remember the exact times, but it seemed to run all day long! Free drinks... an entire table just lined with beers and liquor.... you could make your own, or they would make one for you. And they had little party trays of 'finger food' I don't mean pretzels and peanuts. We had bacon wrapped dates (now one of our favorite things!), olives, shrimp.... they really go all out. You could eat/drink the price of the hotel room in one happy hour sitting... and you don't pay an extra dime! If visiting Amsterdam, make sure you stay there at least one night!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy in the Roemer”
Reviews.Author: JoleneBrussels
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Roemer over Easter and we found it really very nice. We had a room downstairs, Room 11. At first, we found it a little strange to be going downstairs, but it was a really spacious room (compared with most European hotel rooms) with a nice bathroom & jacuzzi tub, it felt like having your own apartment really and it was really quiet. The staff was friendly and helpful. They have a nice made to order breakfast, snacks and drinks in the evening near a cozy fireplace in the common area. It also had a great location just on the edge of the Museumplein on a quiet street. We totally recommend it, we'd definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “My only pick in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Mumindalen
Reviews.Content: Quaint and cozy in a modern sort of way. I really liked it, and felt that Hotel Roemer gave little tips on interior decorating. My boyfriend wanted the "Grass thatch" painting that hung in the hallway, still does :) We had the executive suite, and only stayed one night, which wasn't enough to fully enjoy the room. Tub and all... The backgarden was such a treat, calm and secluded (as secluded as you can get in Amsterdam I guess LOL) Some other reviewers have commented on the size of the rooms, and me never having seen the reg. sized rooms I don't know. However my boyfriend is a BIG guy, 6'6 (2m), and he was very comfortable. This says a lot. We have also travelled a lot so we do have something to compare with. But this begs the question, how much room does one need? I read one amuzing review when the patron was going on about how much the amenities added on the cost of the stay (lcd TV's etc). LOL If one has that attitude, one needs not look any further than the average hostel w no frills. For the rest of us, I assume that Quality is rather experienced in "tighter" quarters than not at all. Stayed in a gigantic room in a Luxury Hotel in Amsterdam, with zero personality that was horrible. I'll happily take Hotel Roemer, and go back when I decide to return to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Blessings”
Reviews.Author: superali99
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights at the beginning of March before I then stayed on in the same hotel for a further 2 nights on my own for business. Even though we arrived late because of delayed flights into Schipol we received a very warm welcome from a lovely girl on reception who couldn't have been more helpful. They helped us with our luggage and showed us around the room. I think they have recently introduced their all-incl policy so were quite keen to tell us about the mini-bar being included as well as the bar downstairs. You also get a carafe of whisky, gin and vodka in your room which all seems rather exotic, but the reality is that we simply didn't use it. I'm not sure how much extra you are paying for this on top of the previous room prices, but I think it would be ideal if you were in Amsterdam for a party weekend, stag, hen etc and were into slamming back shots and draining the mini bar, but we were so busy out and about that we just didn't make best use of it. The downstairs bar use would be ideal if you were lazing around reading newspapers and magazines, I could really see you getting the advantage, but again we were out all the time so didn't get the best use of it. We booked an executive room and I must definitely agree with the previous reviews that say the rooms are tiny. I wouldn't like to see a standard sized room! But we knew this before we went and were prepared for it, and I think that boutique hotels in Amsterdam would be largely the same becuase of the general size of buildings etc in the city. One thing I have to mention is that, as I said at the beginning, I was staying on for two nights on business and had made a separate reservation for a smaller room (limited business expenses!!!) but they linked our two reservations and let me stay in the same room for no extra charge which I thought was very generous of them. Space for breakfast was tight and I don't think they were full so I would think it could only get worse at high season. But if you time it right then I would say the food served is some of the best we've had. Again, staying in boutique hotels comes with some quirks so you need to prepared for them, i.e. one of the breakfast tables is a high level 'breakfast bar' sort of affair which leaves you perched on tall stools. Fine if you're not planning to take your time over things or if you're not dying of hangover!! We came and went as we pleased and there was someone on reception 24/7 as far as we could tell. The biggest downside had to be room service/cleaning. I'm not sure if what we experienced was 'the norm' or if they were a bit short-staffed that week but they really need to give their housekeeping a shake. Our mini bar and coffee was not restocked leaving us with no water etc and considering it was an all-incl they definitely saved a few bucks by not restocking! The standard of cleaning was poor and whilst we didn't expect them to pick up after us, a bit of a tidy up wouldn't have gone a-miss! We ran out of tissues on day one and it wasn't restocked - our fault to a certain extent as we kept forgetting to mention to reception on the way out - and one day we were left with nothing but decaf coffee for the nespresso machine (which is a fab machine by the way!!). Also, the night before I was due to check out, they removed the bathrobes and cut down on the towels, which made us feel a bit cheap as presumably they expected us to try and nick them??!?!?? Our sheets were not changed during the entire stay and, well, most of us at home go at least a week without changing bed linen which meant that we weren't particularly repulsed, but part of staying in a hotel means that you do expect fresh sheets more frequently! Definitely some room for improvement, but overall it didn't really spoil our stay completely as the service from other parts of the hotel compensated. It's very handily located and is convenient for Vondel Park and the museum quarter. It took us more than an hour to wander down to Centraal Station but we were wombling along taking photographs. I reckon if you put your mind to it and were in a hurry you could walk it in 30 mins. Other reviewers have commented on the number of flat screen TVs and I would definitely agree. We had three, one of which we never used because it was pointing towards the whisky corner with chairs that we never used and the one in the bathroom we used about twice, so really just the one in the main bedroom by the bed would be sufficient. Again, it's hard to tell how much extra you end up paying for things like this but I'm sure it's added in somewhere. We would also say that noise carries between the rooms and between the floors - we seemed to be above the kitchen and I was disturbed with banging and crashing from time to time and our room always seemed to smell of cooked food which bothered me some days more than others. But again - overall we would say that it was a pleasant stay and as long as you've read reviews like this and are prepared for what you are going to then it never seems to be so bad!! For what we needed, it did the job. And again - a special mention to the reception staff who were always extremely polite and helpful and willing to go that extra mile. We had a hiccup with a car hire booking and they couldn't have done enough to help and were more than willing to get on the phone and lambast the car hire company for their failings. So thumbs up from us - but please sort out your housekeeping!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: 996cz
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at no less than 10 different hotels in Amsterdam over the years, and I can honestly say that the Roemer surpasses them all. The location is great. It's a three minute walk to the Leidseplein, very close to the museums and to the high fashion street. It is on a quiet, small street so there is little to no noise. I had a room on the top floor overlooking the garden.(Very quiet.) The room was great. Very large for Amsterdam standards. (I did stay on another occassion in a smaller room at the Roemer, which was on the small side, but where it lacked in size it made up in comfort and amenities.) The room is decorated in a modern, stylish yet very comfortable way. The bathrooms are great. T.V's are everywhere. The service was really good. It's not a big hotel and there aren't that many staff members, but everyone was very friendly and did anything to make you enjoy your stay. I ate breakfasts there and ordered room service a few times. The breakfasts were very good--nice selection of meats, cheeses, fruit, juices etc. I highly recommend the Roemer.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel”
Reviews.Author: TDel71
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here May 2007, after reading the great reviews on here. It was a very nice place, although it is a bit off the beaten path , depending on what you want to do. Renting a bike is almost necessary , as the hotel didn't seem to have very many of them for guests. Conveniently, there is a bike rental place nearby. The rooms were nice, clean, with good decor. The only thing that they could improve was a tendency to be a bit understaffed, with often only one person doing all guest interractions, such as checking in/out, getting drinks (there is a nice courtyard in the back) , and helping with information all at the same time. Overall, a very good hotel , and I thought reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Pure pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: jshorty
Reviews.Content: My husband and me have not long arrived back from a fantastic stay at the Roemer. It was pure pleasure and enjoyment. We stayed in a Junior Suite and believe me it was superb! Fab jacuzzi bath,excellent flat screen TVs, 3 of them! Complimentary whisky,gin and vodka also tea and expresso coffee. A DVD player and a docking station for your i-pod. There were fluffy bathrobes, slippers, towels and creams, lotions and toothpaste. Everything yoou needed and more! The staff were extremely pleasant and helpful, the views were lovely and the location was perfect. In fact I don't think I can fault any of it.. well done to everyone at the Roemer who made our stay just right. Will certainly be booking a room here again. Thankyou! Mr and Mrs M. Coventry England

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel tucked away in calm area”
Reviews.Author: ibb
Reviews.Content: A colleague and I stayed one night at this lovely hotel. I must admit, after taking a long, windy trip in a cab to the hotel and seeing the check in desk (which literally is a one-person desk in the entrance of the hotel), I was worried. I am a self-proclaimed hotel snob, so wasn't sure what I had gotten myself into. My fears were quickly erased once I realized the beauty of having such a well-appointed hotel tucked away in a residential neighborhood, yet right near all the action. I could walk anywhere and everywhere...or take the tram which was so easy. The staff was amazing and made me feel comfortable (mainly the bartenders, the front desk woman was new and had a major attitude when I asked her questions). I ended up spending my evening getting drinks in the lobby, talking to the bartenders, and reading a book by the fire in the lobby. It was really relaxing. My room was well appointed and lovely (albeit small). They thought of everything! There was a flatscreen TV in the bathroom too! It was very comfortable and I just loved the way they decorated. I checked out my colleague's room which was ENORMOUS, complete with bathtub and sitting room. If you are worried about the size of the rooms, just be sure to ask-- it seems that they have a wide variety of room types and sizes. When going back through Amsterdam on the way home, we stayed at a much more expensive hotel right on Dam Square, but for me, there was no comparison...I longed for my cozy room at the Roemer!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel/location”
Reviews.Author: lflw
Reviews.Content: We were 2 young couples staying in Amsterdam for 4 days in January and spent 2 nights at Hotel Roemer. The rooms were exceptionally clean and although not massive, were plenty big enough for us. The bathrooms were fantastic with huge showers and jacuzzi baths as well as tv's in them! The breakfast was again a great selection of cereals, fruit, teas and coffees as well as hot breakfast ranging from pancakes to smoked salmon and scrambled eggs to a small English breakfast! The free mini bar in the rooms and the free drinks and snacks in the lounge area from 5pm-1am was an added bonus and the location of the hotel was also great! It's in the quieter part of town, a short walk from the museum district and we only used the trams to get to and from central station with our luggage. I would definately stay here again and would reccomend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: freelander1994
Reviews.Content: Warm and friendly receptionist. Location is great - on the edge of the Leidsplein and the museum district - so whatever takes your fancy! Easy walking distance to most places. We asked for a quiet room (wouldn't want ground floor rooms near bar or lifts) and although we were at the front on the first floor (rm 20), it is a quiet street and we slept soundly. Rooms size was fine for us - not sure it required three tv's tho! Lovely, small fireside lounging area for afternoon tea and cakes (complimentary) and the complimentary bar in the eve - which includes free side bowls of salads, canapes etc - was a lovely touch to set you up for an evening out. Room service was a bit shoddy I must admit, but rooms were very clean (they just left dirty glasses both days and the bed was a bit of a mess after the turn down service!). Overall, found the hotel very pleasant - clean, modern, friendly and great location and would stay again. You do however, have to get up early (I mean 9-10ish - not 10-11ish) for breakfast otherwise you will have to wait for tables as there are very few places to accommodate everyone. Take the hop on/off canal cruise (36euros for 24hrs), be prepared for a 2 hour queue even in winter for a visit to Anne Franks house and take a stroll down the 9 Streets for chic and independent shopping. Take the train from the airport (8 an hour) to the Central Station and a short 12euro taxi ride will get you to the hotel. We uses our canal cruise ticket to take us back to the station in the evening â€“ lovely ride at night time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it but skip this place if you're claustrophobic”
Reviews.Author: TravelBuugg
Reviews.Content: A boutique hotel about a 5 minute walk from Liedseplein which is a happening square. The hotel is definitely small - just as the other reviews mention - but even after expecting a small room I was slightly shocked. You could only fit one person on either side of the bed. There's not much room for luggage and moving about if you're sharing the room with another. The bathroom was pretty tight as well. But the good side is that the room was immaculate - crisp linen, feather comforter, fluffy pillows. The bathroom had a tv so you could enjoy the news while showering. This is an all inclusive hotel which meant that the drinks were free in the minibar and so was breakfast. Breakfast was da-lish! We ordered dutch pancakes every morning. The dutch really know their pancakes. But you may have to wait to get a table, as one reviewer mentioned, since this is a small hotel. And sometimes you have to wait for the front door to be opened as they don't just allow you to walk in. You have to be buzzed in which is nice for security but a pain in the *** when its freezing out and there's no one at the front desk to let you in. Overall, you'll enjoy it. We did!

Reviews.Title: “Many Many buts”
Reviews.Author: Tal200
Reviews.Content: The good part is the location, new rooms and relatively freindly stuff. But, there are too many buts for this hotel: 1. Rooms are very very small, even though I order the executive rooms 2. It is a butique hotel. it means you will wait for breakfast, sometimes wait outside till someone will come to the reception and open the door, etc. 3. When we checked in, there was a half empty bottle of water in the mini bar (!!) 4. When we checked out, I asked to pay in 3 payments (trust me, with the bill you will need it ;-)). they said ok, i signed 3 times, and when i got back home i saw that all payments were taken immedately... <G>. when i called they say there is no policy of payments.... Too much money for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: TongH
Reviews.Content: I was staying at Hotel Roemer during x'mas. Unfortunately, I had to be on my own for one day but the hotel staff made me feel very secure and welcome. The hotel is small but lovely. I booked a double room, it is quite small but it's clean and functional. The location is ok about 5 minutes walk or less from the tram stop (Leidseplein) you can take route 1,2 or 5 and the hotel is more or less on the road behind Mariott. From there you can walk to Rijks museum, Vondel park and many more. Overall, the experience at Hotel Roemer is quite enjoyable and I would definitely return there if I have a chance.

Reviews.Title: “gorgeous chic hotel”
Reviews.Author: kerrywoman
Reviews.Content: lovely place, excellent staff, great location. Found the inclusive policy to be a great idea, the wine in the evening was lovely, not cheap at all. Breakfast was top quality and very plentiful. Our room was an executive one, on ground floor, and it was lovely. Well worth the price I paid, in my view. Really comfy bed, slept so well!! Spacious, bright room - airy and spotlessly clean. Lovely lounge area to sit and read in the room, in addition to the public lounge area near reception (which also has free internet access, very useful).

Reviews.Title: “Chic exclusive hotel in upscale neighbourhood but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: salgys
Reviews.Content: The roemer, as others have written on this review page, is located close to the museum area and upscale shopping street. The hotel is small, with a living room - like lobby, a cosy bar with a very friendly barman. I read the review before I booked and knowing that the rooms are small, I paid more for an executive room (about Euro 340 pernight). Unfortunately, when we arrived, we found our room to be very small and claustrophic except we had a balcony which provide a bit of relief. We went down to the reception and asked but were told it was the executive room. Later, I found out there are rooms in our floor which is bigger so perhaps not all excutive rooms are small. Apart from that, the hotel is wonderful. It's location is perfect with the wonderful Vodler Park right next to it. We rented the hotel black bikes (much more diginty than renting the bright yellow tourist bikes) and had a most wonderful time. One night, we were tired so we ate at their sister hotel the Vodler Hotel across the street. Unfortunately, I had a tummy ache that night.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: LizzyG2307
Reviews.Content: A perfect weekend in Amsterdam. That sums up our experience at the Hotel Roemer. From the moment we were greeted upon our arrival to the final goodbye as we left. Friendly helpful staff who catered to our every need - with a smile and a genuine caring that we were enjoying our stay. Room was amazing, the bathroom to die for. The jacuzzi bath perfect to ease away the strains of walking around Amsterdam all day and the rainfall shower a real treat. We upgraded our room and got everything included - breakfast and all drinks all the time, well worth doing. Decanters of spirits in your room and a mini bar fully stocked. A stylish, comfortable and quiet hotel with a brilliant courtyard decked garden. Located within minutes of all the museums and just a few minutes walk to the Leidsplein and access to all the trams to take you where you wanted to go. It was an amazing 3 day stay and the best recommendation I can give is that we can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “The best location”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth79
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend for four nights in October. We went for a fun break away, and we wer glad we stayed here. I think the greatest thing about the hotel is its location. It is in a quiet street, very close to the nicest shopping street and the vondelpark. The museum district and the De Prijp (best place for non-tourist type restaurants and bars) area are also stroll away. But best of all, its a good distance away from the sleaze of the red light district!The room itself was very nicely decorated - everything is modern and comfortable. The bathroom was lovely with a jacuzzi bath and rain shower. Our main complaint about the room was its size - it was quite small and pokey. However i have heard that this is standard for Amsterdam hotels so we didnt dwell on this. The other negative was that i had booked a twin room and also emailed the hotel to confirm it was in fact a twin. When we arrived it was two beds pushed together that for some reason could not be pulled apart. We were informed this was the only type of room they had, so i felt i had been misled during the booking process. The hotel operates on a 'fully inclusive' basis. This basically means you can have free minibar, drinks in the bar and breakfast. Dont be fooled by this - we just had breads in the morning which can be bought cheaply elsewhere. Plus the booze didnt have labels and we suspect was cheap. We booked thinking this would save us money overall even though the hotel was pricey - i dont think it did so be careful of this trap/gimmick! One other thing to note: we asked the staff twice for help on things to do, and they werent able to do anything for us. While they were very nice people this was disappointing. Overall i have to say we enjoyed ourselves and would consider staying in this hotel again - depending on the price! I definitely believe that the location here made our mini-break.

Reviews.Title: “A brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: EnglandElizabeth
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay in Amsterdam and we absolutely loved this boutique hotel. It was in a good location, a little out of the hustle and bustle but within easy walking distance to the main attractions. The hotel was spotless and the staff were very helpful. My husband loved the television in the bathroom and I loved the Jacuzzi bath - perfect after a day of sightseeing in the cold of January! The hotel bar was lovely - very relaxing for a night-cap before going up to our room! The tram system is excellent and very easy to use to get around. We would recommend a canal trip - that was a nice way to see Amsterdam. Enjoy this great hotel - we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “just perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Londonbabysw19
Reviews.Content: i went on a romantic trip with my girlfriend - its was our 1st overseas holiday together - ofcourse we spend lots of time together already but this was our first time living together and doing everything together for 3 days - as you can imagine the hotel would be very important to us! and i have to say everything was great! when we first arrived we were welcomed and had help taking our luggage to our rooms - the place just had a warm, personal and friendly feeling. The decor is lovely too and very unique boutique style. Our room was perfect - not too big not too small just right for a couple. There was cable TV, ipod docking station, DVD etc and a lovley bed - very clean with modern theme throughout. the bathroom was a bit small but a great shower lovely mirrors. downstairs in the lobby there is internet and also a cosy bar area with great big comfy sofas perfect for rexaling before going out or after you get back - they had every drink possible in the bar and all staff from reception to bar and cleaners were great and friendly! The location is fantatic but get your bearings because the streets look the same so sometimes a wrong turn can put you right off track - the best way to the local bars clubs etc is to go through and behind the Hard Rock Cafe - once here you can get anywhere from the shopping areas right to red light district and dam square. Vondel Park is like 3-5 minutes away and also the trams are great - quick clean and on time they can take you anywhere and fast too! cabs in to dam sqaure are cheap too so if your out late get one back! we got lost on the way home just becuase we preferred to walk talking in the sights and sounds! there are also bikes with a small carrier at the back perfect for 2 people - they are cheap and about 6 euro per person (12 Euro as they only hold 2 people) but you can get these anywhere and the drivers tend to give you a tour, expaining what everything is as you pass - good to know stuff too! all in all we had a great stay and saw and did so much - the hotel is great and i will be staying again soon! thanks for a great stay! and Amsterdam in itself is a lovely place - no matter what your going for you can find it there! the hotel Roemer is great value for money, location, comfort, and ambience! go there!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! i have been to amsterdam about 20 times (my job takes me there too) and on all types of visits from working, with the lads on a crazy weekend, with a girl on a quiet relaxing break, on a music holiday to go clubbing and raving etc - and also a 17 year old years ago to experience the place and definitley the hotel Roemer just had something special so would say its better then the 5 star hotels i stay in when working in amsterdam! thanks! Omar - London!

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: ans206
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the roemer several times for business purposes and for pleasure. The hotel is small and very personal. Rooms are great, remember amsterdam is a small city with often very small hotel rooms, but the roemer has absolutely made the best of it. only 20 rooms and all are different. They all have several tv's, ipod docking statioons and a nice nespresso machine. The bubble baths are a very very nice touch. This also goes for the tv in the bathroom!! The staff is nice and friendly. Ask for a specific room...and they will probably help you. The bar is cosy and small. internetcomputers for free in the lobby, all in all a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and chic rooms”
Reviews.Author: Snouchy
Reviews.Content: The Roemer is in a great location to visit the Van Gogh museum and upscale shopping e.g. Hermes, Zegna etc. It's also close to an extremely tourist area called Leidsplein (sp.?) where all of the wacko's and drunks gather in the evenings. Anyway, we spent two nights at the hotel and it really looks great as you enter the bar/lounge area and then to their patio / garden area out back. The rooms are comfortable, the beds are solid and there is a Nespresso machine in the room which I found to be a nice touch. The staff were generally friendly but seemed disorganized. Either they were all new or just hadn't had sufficient experience running a small boutique hotel. The young man who checked us in was quite arrogant and was little help acting in concierge capacity. The woman working in the bar was a great help and very knowledgeable about local restaurants and bars. The hotel offered us complimentary breakfast for a couple of inconveniences that we experienced during our stay. This was a nice touch and the breakfast was great. Here is an example of the poor management. If your hotel is sold out you should plan for more than 8 people to have breakfast at 9:00 AM on a Sunday morning. Guests were arriving to the breakfast area only to find that seating wasn't available. There was also quite some confusion operating the espresso machine to get espresso drinks for the guests. Anyway ... It's a nice hotel. I would stay at Hotel Roemer again. ** Request a room with a balcony ** I didn't know this was an option until I went out back to see the garden area.

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: imp1
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in July 2007. Smart boutique hotel in an excellent positon of the City. Close enough to walk to all the sights yet just off the main roads to provide a peaceful refuge at the end of the day. We had one of the rooms at the rear of hotel which had a balcony overlooking the well designed garden. Staff were very attentive and friendly. We didn't have the breakfast but there are loads of eating places a short walk away. Decor was very modern and the bath was wonderful - liked the tv in the bathroom. The bed was enourmous and comfy, so much so it was a tight squeeze to get out one side. Housekeeping was a litte lax sometimes - eg tea making facilities not topped up - but this is a minor gripe really, and we would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great stuff and location”
Reviews.Author: Maykush
Reviews.Content: We come to the hotel for 5 days and 4 nights, 4-8 of July. The hotel is cozy and beautiful, as if some one accommodate you in his own house. The stuff is excellent and very welcoming, helping, guiding and always smiling. Rooms are very beautiful and designed. For me, the problem was that the rooms are too small (and I'm talking about the king executive rooms) which made me feel a little in claustrophobic. We had a room with balcony which made the situation a little better. My suggestion, if you do care about the room size, is to take the king executive rooms in the second floor, without balcony, but with much larger space in the room itself (Room number 30). I must say as well, that my wife really liked the room in spite of its size. The location is beautiful, very quit on one hand and very close to the laidsplain on the other hand (3 minutes walking distance). I personally, love to seat in my room, to look out, and to live the city what you can not do here. On the other hand, if you need a quit place after a busy day to relax and in the same time to be very close to the main events, this is the place to come to. I ordered directly with the hotel and not through any internet site and got a much better rate then all the sites offered. I recommend this hotel and think it is a wonderful place to be at during your visit in Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “wohoo!!!”
Reviews.Author: nidhipandey
Reviews.Content: a great hotel..arrived early..room wasnt ready but left our stuff and had a wander in amsterdam stayed in room 28-massive bed, 3 TVs, ipod dock, dvd player-we love our gagets and throughly enjoyed the stuff given! great barman..had welcome drinks and was left alone if we wanted some "us" time down side is that prob breakfast isnt provided..we werent so bothered but i guess if u pay around 250 euros per night for 2 people.....??should it be included also the hotel isnt geared up for food..it comes from its neighbouring hotel--there were some issues with room service...the menu was wrong..no food..cook was unwell...but , well..these things happen i guess...

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sarah-1975
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay at this hotel as a treat for my husbands birthday. We got the train from the airport (20 mins) and then got the tram (either No. 1, 2 or 5), we would recommend anyone to travel this way very clean, cheap and easy to use. We arrived quite early so our room was not ready but they were more than happy to keep our bags for us, we were also offered a free welcome drink which we could have then or later from the bar so we decided to wait until the evening. As the room was not ready we went out for a walk the Hotel is ideally located for the main leidseplein square (5 min walk) where you will find all the main bars and restaurants, and lots of good shops. We had dinner one night at a Restaurant called November which was very tastey and very reasonably priced (would recommend). In the main square there is a bar/cafe called The Bull Dog which do fab pancakes of all types of variety great for breakfast, You can also get your 'smokes' and space cakes/hot chocolate!! if your in to that sort of thing from downstairs in the bull dog which is great. Back at the hotel we checked in about 3pm and were advised we had been upgraded which was a nice suprise and our luggage had already been taken to the room for us which was a nice touch. The room was lovely the bed was huge, there was 3 flat screen tv's one for the bed area 1 in the sitting area and 1 in the bathroom. The Bathroom as a spa bath and a rainfall shower which were fab, the room was very clean and modern with all the mod cons, snazzy coffee maker (you need to ask for suger!) ipod holder, telephone, use of bathrobes (free of charge!) lovely fluffy clean towels. We enjoyed our free welcome drink from the bar when we went out that evening so we both had a glass of wine (you could choose anything though!) On my husbands birthday I had put some balloons up for him and left his cards out on show and when we arrived back in the afternoon the hotel had left us a bottle of champagne on ice which was fantastic and another really nice touch!. Unfortunatelty due to the weather we had, we didnt get to use the outside area but it looked really nice water features and great decking would be lovely in the sunshine!. We didnt have breakfast as we did feel this was a little pricey and it was much cheaper to get something in a local cafe. Overall I cannot fault this hotel and the staff are happy to help nothing is to much trouble, we will definately return here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: sbluey
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic and I'd recommend it to everyone! I was upgraded to the Execuitve Suite which included iPod speakers, TV and DVD in the bedroom and the bathroom, huge mini-bar and a brilliant jacuzzi bath. I was only staying in the room for 7 hours in total, but I made sure I took a bath and used each of the fabulous perks of the room for at least 5 minutes!!

Reviews.Title: “Very original”
Reviews.Author: frequentflier3
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with the Hotel Roemer, and would certainly go back if we could afford it! The location was excellent because it is very quiet, yet easy to get to all the tourist areas. We were very surprised to find that our room had a flat screen television (plus another one in the bathroom). There was also a docking station for iPods (we are too old to have these, but I am sure that young people would find this very convenient). Our only problem was that breakfast cost 20 euros. If this had been included in the price we would have given it five stars.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Uisce
Reviews.Content: Hotel Roemer is a small boutique hotel in a quiet area close to all museums and shopping areas etc. We stayed in room 21, a small (but executive king) room and in some ways a little cramped but the balcony with two chairs and small table increases the size of the room by a third with a lovely view over the back gardens of the nearby houses, it is Amsterdam afterall and only newly built hotels have large rooms in general. The room was sparkling clean, toiletries are of a good quality, the mini bar is well stocked, strangely though ours was missing sparkling wine/champagne. An espresso machine was in the room as I believe it is in most rooms but was not supplied with sugar or milk (a Dutch way of drinking coffee) and tea was not available either. I take it this is normal but when we asked for what we wanted,it arrived almost immediately with a smile and 'nothing's a problem' attitude. The room service menu is limited and only available until 11pm but it is a small boutique hotel so there are some sacrifices! Breakfast was a small dissapointment and the only aspect of our three day stay we were not happy with, but not sufficiently unhappy to complain. However, drinks are always served with snacks, coffee with tiny muffins and soft and alcololic drinks with beer nuts, a lovely touch. The staff were warm and friendly, Joost the evening barman is an expert at judging if guests want to be left alone or have company, chatting, suggestions for trips, restaurants etc. He makes a mean cocktail and is very helpful and friendly. The hotel has a cosy, warm and intimate feel to it, almost like being a guest in someone's house. Although while we were there there were aIso business travelers holding meetings in the hotel and they seemed to be as delighted as tourists. I would highly recommend it this hotel if boutique luxury in central Amsterdam with a cosy atmosphere is what you are looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be better-traveller from South Africa”
Reviews.Author: FreedSA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 7 nights at gorgeous Hotel Roomer. It was my first visit to Amsterdam and the celebration of a 'special' birthday. Our choice of hotel was perfect! Our loft room was spotless, stylish and had wonderful facilities not often found at other hotels. The airconditioning, dvd player, flat screen TVs (with one in the bathrom!), coffee maker, Ipod docking station, jetted bath and rain shower enhanced our stay. And the staff were wonderful too-they were warm, welcoming and helpful. Nothing was too much for them. We experienced 5 star service. Joost was a most passionate barman and had an expert knowledge of dining options in the city. I was pleasantly surprised on my birthday with a bottle of chilled champagne sent to the room (thanks to Simone and Joost for all their care and making my birthday so memorable). The cosy lounge with an open fireplace, magazines and newspapers, laptops with complimentary internet access and a view of the newly established decked garden provided home-away-from-home comforts. The hotel is well situated away from the touristy areas, but within easy walking distance of tram stops, cafes and restaurants, museums, shops and main squares. Less than a 5 minute walk from the hotel is the upmarket designer shopping street in Amsterdam. We highly recommend this gem of a hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Cosy Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pink_fluffy_mushroom
Reviews.Content: Loved the decor....so cool! Great furniture and lighting and lovely bar area with a fireplace. The staff are awesome, really friendly and nothing is too much trouble. Our room was clean and stylish, perhaps a little on the snug side with no drawers for storage but we were offered a bigger room if we wanted to change the next day but once we got settled we didn't want to move! Cool touches in the room included an i-pod dock, espresso machine, LCD TV's in the bedroom and bathroom and a UK plug socket over one of the European ones! Sometimes could hear other people in their rooms but that didn't cause too much trouble. Overall a great place to stay in a nice quiet street!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Roemer
HotelInfo.Address: Roemer Visscherstraat 8-10, Amsterdam 1054 EX, The Netherlands
